intro: Habracanthus malacus, commonly known as the Malacan Island bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as mountain forests. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in the summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
